description.narrative: (Albania): FY18 funds will support the Government of Albania's (GoA) National CVE Strategy to promote civic participation and empower civil society to build community resilience. In line with Albania's ICS Sub-Obj. 2.2.1, USAID's PLGP will work with the GoA National Director for the Center to Counter VE and implement activities in two municipalities. Political marginalization makes youth vulnerable to VE in Albania, and PGLP will focus assistance toward municipal governments to increase their capacity in various resource, engagement, and service oriented provisions; and provide technical assistance primarily to municipal governments; and create avenues for political participation and community development support services. FY18 funds will build on USAID's previous work with Community Advisory Panels to create similar panels for at-risk youth. These panels will be forums for young people to interact with local government, civil society, religious, and business leaders, countering marginalization and social exclusion. The panels will also link to a mentoring program with civil society leaders to increase community resilience against attempts to radicalize youth. Work will also focus heavily on the roles of women and girls to prevent radicalization and recruitment.FY18 funds will assist local officials to engage at-risk populations in local programs to build community centers and libraries; rehabilitate small sports and cultural facilities; improve parks where families can spend time; and reinforce safe spaces created by PAS-coordinated programs, including the "Schools as Community Center" network. This program will identify and recommend alternatives for at-risk youth, including channeling at-risk youth toward Albanian government-sponsored and other vocational and life-skills training programs. The project will coordinate closely with working groups and public safety councils in the target areas supported by other donors.....

Objectives for Albania: The projects aims to help administrative units to improve tax collection; increase own-source revenues; to better manage assets; and to increase the predictability, accuracy, and transparency of budgetary processes through e-government solutions, and to increase citizen participation in local government decision-making. The project also aims to establish effective CVE cooperation between Central and Local Government Institutions and Civil Society through CVE Forums in partner municipalities.
